chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:32 PM - cases called - 22CF90 (tracking), 22CF95 (tracking), 22CF139.  Defendant Mercadys A Perkins appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney John Zich in court for Mercadys A Perkins.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding this matters.  Court questions Atty Zich/Defendant.  Responses by Atty Zich/Defendant.  Defendant has signed a wavier form.  Court finds the waiver of the preliminary hearing is free and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Statement by Atty Zich regarding request for bond modification in 22CF95.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Court lowers the cash bond to $750.00.  Statement by Atty Zich regarding bond condition.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Court will allow an employment exception to the bond conditions.

2:22 PM - cases called - 22CF95 and 22CF90.  Defendant Mercadys A Perkins appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney John Zich appeared by video for Mercadys A Perkins.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court questions Atty Zich.  Response by Atty Zich.  State objects to an adjournment - Defendant did not waive time limits/officer is present to testify.  Court finds time limits were not waived and will proceed.  Office Connor Monk duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Officer Monk.  State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Lincoln Count Case No. 22CF90.  Court takes judicial notice.  Cross by Atty Zich.  No argument.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information will not mirror the criminal complaint.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty to all counts.  Court accepts not guilty plea to all counts.  Bond will continue.
